items.q: Which mountain range forms the natural border between Europe and Asia?
items.explanation: The Ural Mountains run from north to south through western Russia, conventionally separating Europe from Asia.

items.q: Iceland is covered entirely in ice, whereas Greenland is mostly green.
items.explanation: The reality is notoriously inverse; Iceland is surprisingly green due to the Gulf Stream, while Greenland is mostly covered in a massive ice sheet.

items.q: South Africa is the only country in the world that has three official capital cities.
items.explanation: Its administrative capital is Pretoria, legislative is Cape Town, and judicial is Bloemfontein.

items.q: What is the capital city of Canada?
items.explanation: Located in the province of Ontario, Ottawa sits on the south bank of the Ottawa River.

items.q: Which crucial man-made canal connects the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea?
items.explanation: Located in Egypt, it allows ships a much shorter route between Europe and Asia by avoiding navigation around Africa.

items.a: An archipelago is an extensive group or chain of closely scattered islands.
items.explanation: Japan, Indonesia, and the Philippines are examples of archipelago nations.

items.q: Name the smallest independent country in the world by both land area and population.
items.explanation: It is an independent city-state enclaved entirely within Rome, Italy.

items.q: Which South American country has the largest land area and population?
items.explanation: It is the fifth largest country in the world globally and is famous for the Amazon rainforest.

items.q: What two nations share the longest undefended international border in the world?
items.explanation: The border stretches over 5,500 miles, including the borders across the Great Lakes.

items.q: Which major river flows through London?
items.explanation: It has been crucial to the development of London since Roman times.
